alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 11:14PM EDT until July 03 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Laurel, Pulaski, Rockcastle and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, London, Burnside, Bent, Dykes, Grade, Shopville, Valley Oak, Mount Victory, Ruth, Bloss, Billows, Dabney, Pongo, Elihu, Bunch, Luner, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Tateville and General Burnside S.P.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
